item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Making difficult choices is a part of life that invades your mind on an ongoing base and creating a game that hinges on this factor is also no easy task.

Making difficult choices is a part of life that invades your mind on an ongoing base and creating a game that hinges on this factor is also no easy task.
Making difficult choices is a part of life that invades your mind on an ongoing base and creating a game that hinges on this factor is also no easy task.
XCOM: Enemy Within is an expansion pack from XCOM: Enemy Unknown. Although filled with new challenges and badass toys, I stress that it is not sequel. There are new maps to brawl in, a vast array of weapons and strategies to experiment with and my personal favorite, the meld option. This allows you to genetically fuse your soldiers with mechanoids i.e. Robocop. The idea of becoming the weapon is not original but it doesn’t take away the “badassery” of this concept. Like all addictive games, there will always be that irritating goon, in enemy within, they take shape in the form of squid like aliens known as Seekers. Their directive, seek out isolated soldiers and take them out effectively. I must say I hate them.
Given that “the aliens have invaded and we are seriously kicking their butts” theme has been seriously explored in many forms than I can count. It has always left me wondering, if you managed cross the vast spans of space, conquering civilization after civilization, surely by now you should be an efficient fighting force??? The game tends to get too easy and the aliens get their Asses handed to them.
In conclusion, it’s an awesome strategy game and I look forward to playing it even further.

Football is one of the most physically and mentally challenging activities one can partake in. Let’s forget about the big name signings, the controversial verbal slurs between coaches and the all famous barbaric fans. For now, lets move the game to a more civil environment. Lets truly bring the beautiful game to your living room.

Football is one of the most physically and mentally challenging activities one can partake in. Let’s forget about the big name signings, the controversial verbal slurs between coaches and the all famous barbaric fans. For now, lets move the game to a more civil environment. Lets truly bring the beautiful game to your living room.
Lets get one thing straight. Creating a true football simulator is no easy task. You have to take in to consideration that the human mind and body are imperfect tools for creating a perfect masterpiece. What do I mean by that? Take football and personify it, give it life if you may. The rules that govern it are simple yet effective in allowing this being to reach its purpose and its purpose is ultimate entertainment. By this virtue one must conclude that football is the perfect game.
Given this philosophy I have to commend Konami for creating the best football simulator yet. Pro Evolution Soccer 2014 is not a game about football; it is a footballer’s game. They have managed to emulate certain subtle attributes about football that the conscious mind seldom pays attention to e.g. how a player’s center of gravity can determine the direction and pace of how he will pass the ball, the physics of interactions between players tackling each other. Those small but very important details about football matter because to me, the game is not just about getting the ball to the other side. It’s about creating a master piece using eleven imperfect tools.
Like most games, PES 2014 does have imperfections and the most notable and frustrating one is the lag that accurse every time there’s a serious attempt on goal. Its as if the world literally comes to a stop! It’s really frustrating because that one bug kills the flow and mood of the game. If there’s anyway to fix this Konami please do so.
This rating is solely based on the entertainment factor, not graphics or any other gimmick. The game does what it is supposed to do. It entertains!!!

Blizzard entertainment, the makers of the Diablo franchise, have managed to rule the Role Playing Game (RPG) genre for close to a decade. With the release of their latest console installment, Diablo III, it becomes more apparent that they maintain their position as the leader in this genre.

Blizzard entertainment, the makers of the Diablo franchise, have managed to rule the Role Playing Game (RPG) genre for close to a decade. With the release of their latest console installment, Diablo III, it becomes more apparent that they maintain their position as the leader in this genre.
The world of Diablo III is tremendously enormous. From the onset you’re caught between the tasks of choosing your Class. To cut a long story short, my heart chose the monk class, for some reason I kept getting images of Aang the last air bender. Don’t get me wrong Diablo is no child’s game, the setting is self-explanatory; this is a seriously dark game. One wonders if the devil could have made it himself.
Like the classic RPG it is, you’re immediately thrown in to the age-old battle between good and evil and as you progress, the game becomes more intriguing and challenging. Given the class you may have chosen, certain upgrades will afford you abilities unique to your class and I must say, so far I’m the baddest monk in the land.
I look forward to playing some more of this epic RPG and cant wait to see what party tricks the creators of this game have dished up for me.

*Singing*
Are you ready kids "Aye Aye Captain"
I Can't hear you "AYE AYE CAPTAIN"
Ohh...
Who lives in a pineapple under the sea
"Spongebob squarepants!!"

This is by far one the most pointlessly fun games I have played in a while. It’s not about the common nostalgic relapses we all experience from time to time. It is just a purely fun game.
The game is filled with ruthless obstacles, strange robotic henchmen and gigantic machines controlled by the villainous Plankton. To battle these comical foes you’re given an arsenal of goofy weapons, my favorite being the exploding pie gun. You’re also given the option of playing with various characters from the actual cartoon and I must say, Sponge Bob is nothing without Patrick, this is the type of bromance that makes Han Solo and Chewbacca look like mere acquaintances.
So if you’re in to turning off your adult eyes and you just purely want to have fun like a three year old on a sugar rush and a crayon in his hand, then this is undoubtedly the game for you.
